title: Grade 10 - Launching and Leading a Business BEP2O (2024)
subject: Business Studies

document.title: Grade 10 - Launching and Leading a Business BEP2O (2024)

380D6E75CCB84D68A13175F6AC6203AC.description: demonstrate how to manage human resource issues that might arise in a business, including ethical issues related to employees, the environment, and communities

C01D4FED081145D7ADD60CAADEC7EDA1.description: explain the role of management in leading others in a business, including a manager’s ethical, moral, and legal responsibilities and considerations

7BE8C986E5814528B46F2C46F48070AB.description:
Management of Human Resources:
demonstrate an understanding of the role of management in supporting a team of employees, including a manager’s ethical, moral, and legal responsibilities and considerations

93810987E1AE4FC3868B33D6100C8EBC.description: demonstrate an understanding of the role and importance of non-financial reporting and how it helps to communicate their venture’s impact and commitment to responsible practices

1915C9FDEBB141C78768C8BEA500F81F.description: analyze basic financial statements for a small business to determine its financial position and performance

5840BFAB65D44D0A9D52955A4AB04486.description: demonstrate an understanding of tracking cash inflows and outflows for a small business and the responsibility of reporting on performance

51E95C143D1C44969F2B4BDE45E58C06.description: explain the role and importance of both financial and management accounting for a business in decision making and in building transparency and trust, internally and externally

D59148D4FD374D96A256B5EA5F36FA8A.description:
Accounting: 
demonstrate an understanding of the role and importance of accounting to the entrepreneurial process and to the development and growth of a small business

C0FC09493E184B69A72120161CC3B637.description: describe the four Ps of marketing, including how they complement each other to attract customers, and create a marketing mix for their entrepreneurial venture

B491D80BFA8F4F459D03F7DBC75E74C1.description: explain how their venture is best suited for their target customer and how it distinguishes itself from the competition through its value proposition and competitive advantages

756190B3E17840D4B5FF3EEE9CAF606B.description: create a mission statement based on the unique selling proposition and brand values of their entrepreneurial venture

C013DEE6C95C46C19051E350E24F5A56.description: analyze how various businesses have successfully used different marketing strategies for different target markets

2C2F4103274B425AA8C90A15E8BA1A93.description:
Marketing:
demonstrate an understanding of the “three Cs” (company, customer, and competition) and the “four Ps” (product, price, place, and promotion), including how different strategies can be used in different markets

6A4E703DD51E497C894061B1556AB910.description: outline a process for producing their product or delivering their service in an efficient, healthy, safe, ethical, and sustainable way

E2D5427693F64B009E15AA688FD00B29.description: examine and evaluate how various businesses have enhanced the efficiency, health and safety practices, ethics, and sustainability of their production or delivery processes

BC2DAE6A02CF46F69234B4CBE1C22F59.description: describe the processes involved in the production of a product or the delivery of a service

B1FFFBD91A9146CBA378B23D850307A8.description:
Operations:
demonstrate an understanding of the processes involved in producing a product or delivering a service, and develop a process for producing their product or delivering their service, identifying ways to improve the process overall

48C6B143C251437D89950FE11457D4EB.description: analyze ethical sales strategies and respectful, accessible customer service approaches and apply them to their entrepreneurial venture

6C916EB3D23645C89273B79717AF4723.description: launch an entrepreneurial venture and lead it towards achieving their identified goals and key performance indicators

54C474B1FF2C44948CE4ED5B13AD3080.description: identify and compare various supports, including funding opportunities, available for entrepreneurs in their community to help them launch a venture

3925CB3EB5344AAFA9AE5D56E0A6FB3D.description:
Financing and Launching an Entrepreneurial Venture:
launch an entrepreneurial venture by identifying funding opportunities and sales strategies that will help them to achieve their goals and key performance indicators

C40536FCDD5C4C62BF939A47CA2B9273.description: calculate their venture’s startup budget and conduct a break-even analysis to ensure their venture’s financial viability

B6298FAA9AEF439EB31CF11D8D3F138C.description: identify the logistics, resources, and requirements needed for their entrepreneurial venture in order to assess its feasibility

3E8D143CBB074093B2AB70FDCAED1C33.description: consider the target market and competition for their venture, and create a brand that captures its personality and identity

A79540F321E54AB8B30192F9FEB71CA2.description: identify key performance indicators for their venture to measure its progress and success

78CCAB388EBF4C5AB69711E1AFC3F23F.description:
Planning an Entrepreneurial Venture:
identify and plan the various components necessary for their entrepreneurial venture’s development, and evaluate the feasibility of their venture throughout the planning process

CAFCD9ED71154AD595C60BA1DD4AB7C9.description: use a pitch process to effectively communicate their entrepreneurial idea to various audiences for the purpose of gathering support for a potential entrepreneurial venture

F41AD1697EC849AE9E067ECCB0F5053B.description: use a problem solving process to assess and refine their entrepreneurial idea and prototype, considering social, economic, environmental, and ethical impacts

05A0C46C008C4AA48DD2DE02B798A285.description: use a design process to identify how to meet a market need or opportunity; select and develop an entrepreneurial idea to pursue; and create a prototype that takes into account the end-user experience

D9D0EB406A4E4845B6632329B837D34E.description: describe what constitutes an entrepreneurial mindset, and how their own lived experiences can help them to create and innovate new products or services

640B0310C9C945C487050DB3C7840B6E.description:
The Entrepreneurial Mindset: Designing, Refining, and Pitching an Idea:
develop, refine, and pitch an entrepreneurial idea by using design, problem solving, and pitch processes as well as an entrepreneurial mindset

98C64194D2034E0DA30A4CF4C8826210.description: analyze the ways in which various Canadian businesses are working with Indigenous entrepreneurs, businesses, or organizations, as well as First Nations, Métis, and Inuit individuals or communities, and describe how this contributes to reconciliation

A06C7BB98EDE4BDEBCF9C608E808F361.description: compare the actions taken and innovations made by various Canadian businesses to become more socially and environmentally responsible

A9C48986D4DB408697C5D02E65A3E4F4.description: describe the different types of businesses in Canada and their role in domestic and global economies

F6759E72A2054AE6BE20F49519A23230.description:
Business in Canada:
demonstrate an understanding of the various types of businesses that compose Canada’s economy, and analyze the effect of their activity and innovation on communities and domestic and global economies

FEF6B081093E4D378B87143DC5D4CE1C.description: explain how different levels of government in Canada, as well as non-governmental bodies, may intervene in an attempt to correct market failures and to create a more fair, competitive, and responsible market environment

B61406003518443F9A58E442C963AA6B.description: describe how trade relationships Canada has with other countries have an impact on Canadian markets and on Canadian business activities and decisions

11E296D1E1E54C8B884F24275157F6EC.description: analyze how different competitive market structures affect business activities in Canada

9BEB8EDE339C48549D37E2ABA1D63BEF.description:
The Competitive Market Environment in Canada:
demonstrate an understanding of the competitive market environment in Canada and the ways in which economic systems, trade relationships, and governments influence it

83C74A3AEC3C4BA5BE00D7292A847D9A.description: describe how various groups in Canada have been affected by current and past market forces beyond their control

911E8A3834F54EAEA495759C6A9CAC58.description: describe how the needs and wants of consumers and the scarcity and choice of goods and services impact consumer behaviour and how businesses respond to that behaviour

81521A02301344E29539A425BF5AB9D3.description: explain how market forces affect the supply, demand, and price of goods and services and economic cycles

F580BC12325245E6AC7A7187B47C5615.description:
Market Forces:
demonstrate an understanding of how businesses respond to market forces, including supply and demand, and the needs and wants of consumers

441ECB56376F47B7991CE5CAD7CC7B80.description: analyze challenges faced by entrepreneurs from various communities, and identify supports available to help address these challenges

FF6E42D6660A415E954FA40840B3757E.description: describe the contributions and impacts of successful entrepreneurs from diverse local, Canadian, and global communities

ED8E9C55654E4989B642EEFD3D9C1A95.description: describe ways in which different entrepreneurial ventures have addressed social, economic, environmental, and ethical issues

B7B258BB410E4B688B6A42EEC5B078D2.description:
Contributions of Entrepreneurs: 
describe how entrepreneurs contribute to social, economic, and environmental progress, and analyze challenges that they face, identifying ways to address these challenges

C4865E48089C40AFB8DB4767E099B87E.description: create and maintain a portfolio that illustrates their business competencies and growth as an entrepreneur

C2DA4F85FA094E848E6D5C7DA041CC55.description: describe how their learning in this course can be applied in a variety of careers, including self-employment, entrepreneurship, or skilled trades

D487C51A17944AEFA8AC020A450B09D5.description: analyze and explain how business skills and knowledge, including financial literacy, can support learning in other subject areas, in-school job skills programs, and community-based programs

89E3C220F21E4311A12BFEC7E99169EC.description: describe ways in which problem solving and creative and critical thinking can be applied to address local and global real-world opportunities and challenges

37CA6C2988804B14AAE6476818653C22.description:
Connections, Applications, and Careers:
analyze how business skills and knowledge can be applied in other subject areas and in a variety of careers

AABF17EDF673409C8B7ABAB4E0428210.description: select and use the most appropriate digital technologies, tools, and applications to complete a variety of business-related tasks and projects

4E73C945817C403F83BFFF6661765B9C.description: analyze and compare the benefits, limitations, costs, and risks, including risks to online safety and data security, associated with various digital technologies, tools, and applications used to complete business-related tasks and projects

C00043D1AE43408EB282EBE0FE06AE29.description: identify a variety of existing and emerging digital technologies, tools, and applications designed to support the completion of various business-related tasks and projects

9CF99F28E87348D7A367A3741D36E2A6.description:
Business Technologies:
demonstrate an understanding of business-related digital technologies and use them in a way that respects their own and others’ online safety and data security to complete a variety of business-related tasks and projects

6BBE40BFE15C4BE6BEAF03E87D6654FD.description: evaluate tasks and projects on a regular basis in terms of goals, key performance indicators, and outcomes, taking into account feedback gathered from a variety of sources

977933A6797B40B883ECA6F5FBE67DC9.description: use a project management process to manage the main aspects of a business project, including goals, key performance indicators, resources, delegation of tasks and responsibilities, progress of tasks, deadlines, and risks, while demonstrating a leadership style appropriate to each situation

B2465BC533334CDCB029389934121976.description: compare various business leadership styles and explain why it might be appropriate to use a particular style in a particular situation

B7E9C9E50F52453EB2A9E8FC2A3FDDB2.description:
Business Leadership and Project Management: 
demonstrate an understanding of various business leadership styles and use a project management process when performing business-related tasks

E8F68161380F43BA823294F202A210B8.description: Business Leadership, Project Management, and Connections
